trans-unit.source: Enumerates the files and subdirectories for the specified directory with a name that matches the template

seg-source.mrk: Enumerates the files and subdirectories for the specified directory with a name that matches the template

target.mrk: Enumerates the files and subdirectories for the specified directory with a name that matches the template

trans-unit.source: [optional] The flag that specifies whether to enumerate files, subdirectories, or both.

seg-source.mrk: The flag that specifies whether to enumerate files, subdirectories, or both.

target.mrk: The flag that specifies whether to enumerate files, subdirectories, or both.

trans-unit.source: This parameter can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: [optional] A template that using to enumerating files and directories. For example, "*.jpe;*.jpeg;*.jpg".

seg-source.mrk: A template that using to enumerating files and directories.

target.mrk: A template that using to enumerating files and directories.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether the specified template is used to exclude files, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether the specified template is used to exclude files, valid values:

target.mrk: Specifies whether the specified template is used to exclude files, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - The files matching the template will not be enumerated.

seg-source.mrk: True - The files matching the template will not be enumerated.

target.mrk: True - The files matching the template will not be enumerated.

trans-unit.source: False - The only those files that match the template will be enumerated (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - The only those files that match the template will be enumerated (Default).

target.mrk: False - The only those files that match the template will be enumerated (Default).

trans-unit.source: a 2D array containing the following information:

seg-source.mrk: a 2D array containing the following information:

target.mrk: a 2D array containing the following information:

trans-unit.source: [n][1] - The time (UTC) when the file was created.

seg-source.mrk: [n][1] - The time (UTC) when the file was created.

target.mrk: [n][1] - The time (UTC) when the file was created.

trans-unit.source: [n][2] - The time (UTC) when the file was last accessed.

seg-source.mrk: [n][2] - The time (UTC) when the file was last accessed.

target.mrk: [n][2] - The time (UTC) when the file was last accessed.

trans-unit.source: [n][3] - The time (UTC) when the file was last changed.

seg-source.mrk: [n][3] - The time (UTC) when the file was last changed.

target.mrk: [n][3] - The time (UTC) when the file was last changed.

trans-unit.source: [n][4] - The size of the file, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: [n][4] - The size of the file, in bytes.

target.mrk: [n][4] - The size of the file, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: [n][5] - The allocation size of the file, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: [n][5] - The allocation size of the file, in bytes.

target.mrk: [n][5] - The allocation size of the file, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the NTSTATUS error code.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the NTSTATUS error code.

target.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the NTSTATUS error code.

trans-unit.source: If the target directory is empty or no files matched the specified criteria, the function still returns an array where zeroth array element set to 0.

seg-source.mrk: If the target directory is empty or no files matched the specified criteria, the function still returns an array where zeroth array element set to 0.

target.mrk: If the target directory is empty or no files matched the specified criteria, the function still returns an array where zeroth array element set to 0.
